entry.title: Minimum Path Sum
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Minimum Path Sum.

Description

Given a m x n grid filled with non-negative numbers, find a path from top left to bottom right which minimizes the sum of all numbers along its path.

Note: You can only move either down or right at any point in time.

Solution

Analysis For DP

  • State: sum[i][j] represents 到达第i行第j列为止所达到的path sum 最小
  • Function: sum[i][j] = MIN(sum[i-1][j],sum[i][j-1]) + grid[i][j], i>1,j>1,i<m,j<n
  • Initialization: f[0][0] = grid[0][0]; sum[i][0] = sum[i-1][0] + triangle[i][0]; sum[0][j] = sum[0][j-1] + grid[0][j]
  • Answer: sum[m-1][n-1]

entry.title: Triangle
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Triangle.

Description

Given a triangle, find the minimum path sum from top to bottom. Each step you may move to adjacent numbers on the row below.

For example, given the following triangle

The minimum path sum from top to bottom is 11 (i.e., 2 + 3 + 5 + 1 = 11).

Note:
Bonus point if you are able to do this using only O(n) extra space, where n is the total number of rows in the triangle.

Solution

Analysis For DP

  • State: f[i][j] represents 到达第i行第j列为止所达到的path sum 最小
  • Function: f[i][j] = MIN(f[i-1][j],f[i-1][j-1])+triangle[i][j], j<=i
  • Initialization: f[0][0] = triangle[0][0];f[i][0]=f[i-1][0]+triangle[i][0];f[i][i]=f[i-1][i-1]+triangle[i][i]
  • Answer: f[list.length-1][j]

entry.title: Top K Frequent Elements
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Top K Frequent Elements.

Description

Given a non-empty array of integers, return the k most frequent elements.

For example,
Given [1,1,1,2,2,3] and k = 2, return [1,2].

Note:
You may assume k is always valid, 1 ≤ k ≤ number of unique elements.
Your algorithm’s time complexity must be better than O(n log n), where n is the array’s size.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. Time complexity is O(n)
  2. Use HashMap to count the frequency of each number, key is number ,value is frequency
  3. Create a array with List, the maximum size is the 1+length of nums. Because we need consider that we only have multiple one number. The index of this number is length.
  4. Put the number which has the same frequency together.
  5. At last from the end to start, add the small list into list until the list size is not less than k.

Solution2

  1. Time complexity is O(n+nlogk)
  2. Use MinHeap. Each time we poll minimum element from PriorityQueue. Then we can keep track of k most significant entries.
  3. Iterate through the final heap and get the keys.

entry.title: Counting Bits
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Count Bits.

Description

Given a non negative integer number num. For every numbers i in the range 0 ≤ i ≤ num calculate the number of 1’s in their binary representation and return them as an array.

Example:
For num = 5 you should return [0,1,1,2,1,2].

Follow up:

It is very easy to come up with a solution with run time O(n*sizeof(integer)). But can you do it in linear time O(n) /possibly in a single pass?
Space complexity should be O(n).
Can you do it like a boss? Do it without using any builtin function like __builtin_popcount in c++ or in any other language.

Hint:

You should make use of what you have produced already.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. Time complexity is O(n*(size of num)), but time limit exceeded.
  2. count each number from 0 to num

Solution2

  1. Similar to solution1.
  2. Prevent from TLE, we use bit manipulation instead of normal operation.

Solution3

  1. Recursion. Make Use of what I have produced already.
  2. Time complexity is O(n)

Solution4

The number in one range are equal to 1 plus all of the numbers in the ranges before it. For example, the numbers 8-15 have the same pattern as 0-7 but with a 1 at the front.

entry.title: JAVA Web 01
entry.content:
HttpServlet

一、HttpServlet首先必须读取Http请求的内容。Servlet容器负责创建HttpServlet对象，并把Http请求直接封装到HttpServlet对象中，大大简化了HttpServlet解析请求数据的工作量。HttpServlet容器响应Web客户请求流程如下：

1）Web客户向Servlet容器发出Http请求；

2）Servlet容器解析Web客户的Http请求；

3）Servlet容器创建一个HttpRequest对象，在这个对象中封装Http请求信息；

4）Servlet容器创建一个HttpResponse对象；

5）Servlet容器调用HttpServlet的service方法，把HttpRequest和HttpResponse对象作为service方法的参数传给HttpServlet对象；

6）HttpServlet调用HttpRequest的有关方法，获取HTTP请求信息；

7）HttpServlet调用HttpResponse的有关方法，生成响应数据；

8）Servlet容器把HttpServlet的响应结果传给Web客户。

二、创建HttpServlet的步骤——“四部曲”

1）扩展HttpServlet抽象类；

2）覆盖HttpServlet的部分方法，如覆盖doGet()或doPost()方法；

3）获取HTTP请求信息。通过HttpServletRequest对象来检索HTML表单所提交的数据或URL上的查询字符串；

4）生成HTTP响应结果。通过HttpServletResponse对象生成响应结果，它有一个getWriter()方法，该方法返回一个PrintWriter对象。

Conclusion

Servlet主要功能是接受从浏览器发送来的HTTP请求（request），并返回HTTP响应（response）,这个在service方法中完成，service中包含了从request对象获得客户端数据和向response对象创建输出。如果Servlet 继承了 HttpServlet,实现了doPost或doGet方法，那么service只能对POST或GET做出响应。

Example:

Question

  1. 关于response.setContentTyep()： response的的设置对应你看到的html，setContentType对应这句

    意思是告诉浏览器我的这个内容是文本html，然后字符编码是utf-8，如果你不告诉浏览器编码，那么浏览器，一般会根据系统默认编码来解析你的页面中的字符。

  2. Response：封装响应消息，设置响应消息

    • 设置响应行：HTTP/1.1 200 ok

      • setStatus(int code)：设置响应状态码

        • 演示重定向：302
          //简化版的重定向
          response.sendRedirect(“http://192.168.1.66:8080/zxc/one“);

          • 实现原理
            //1.设置响应状态码为 302
            response.setStatus(302);
            //2.设置响应头 location
            response.setHeader(“location”, “http://192.168.1.66:8080/zxc/one“);

    • 设置响应头：

      • setHeader(String name,String value):
      • setDateHeader(String name, long date)
      • setIntHeader(String name, int value)

    • 设置响应体：

      • getOutputStream():发送字节数据

        • 验证码：
          • 防止恶意注册

      • getWriter():发送字符数据

        • 发送中文数据时，需要在获取流之前设置编码方式，并且要告诉客户端浏览器，服务器使用的编码方式
          //简化版设置编码的方式
          response.setContentType(“text/html;charset=utf-8”);
  1. response.setHeader():

四大域

  1. PageContext: is only used in JSP for variables that don’t get passed if the request is forwarded.
  2. ServletRequest: data can only exists during one request for one user.
  3. HttpSession: only one user can use. An application may manage many sessions.
  4. ServletContext: All users in entire web application can use.

EL and JSTL

In order to make the code more readable, we use EL instead of JAVA in HTML. It’s more like HTML tags. It’s only used for getting data in page, request, session and applicaiton scopes.

JDBC

JDBC 连接步骤：

抽取JDBC工具类模板

1.创建数据库配置文件: dbcfg.properties

2.抽取模板

3.When you want to use this util class:

大数据存储

We can use batch processing, each time we excute a list of inserts in batch. Instead of hitting database once for each insert statement, we will use JDBC batch operation and optimize the performance.

存储过程

Stored procedures: A benefit of stored procedures is that you can centralize data access logic into a single place that is then easy for DBA’s to optimize. Stored procedures also have a security benefit in that you can grant execute rights to a stored procedure but the user will not need to have read/write permissions on the underlying tables. This is a good first step against SQL Injection.

触发器

Trigger: A trigger is a special kind of stored procedure that automatically executes when an event occurs in the database server.

DataSource Pool

新建一个连接池，每次从连接池去conn, 用完后放回池中，而不是直接conn.close()。
因此我们需要改写close()方法，使用包装设计模式(Decorator), implement Connection,改写close()方法，不用改变的方法直接调用原来的方法。

Filter

实现自动登录功能：
把用户名：Base64编码，把密码：MD5加密。存入Cookie中，登录时取出解析并与数据库中的用户名和密码比较。

Filter先执行，chain.doFilter(request,reponse)过滤之后再执行servlet.

Listener

文件上传

  1. 表单的method必须是post
  2. 表单的enctype属性值必须是multipart/form-data
  3. 表单中提供input type=”file”类型的上传输入域

显示上传文件条

使用Ajax+Listener, 不断监听文件上传多少，使用ajax不断回取数据以及更新图样。

8个监听器

  1. ServletContextListener: 完成系统初始化工作
  2. HttpSessionListener: 可以统计HttpSession对象的个数，分析某个时间段同时在线的人数
  3. ServletRequestListener: 可以统计每个页面的访问次数
  4. HttpSessionAttributeListener: 显示在线用户列表,session.setAttribute(“user”,user);
  5. ServletContextAttributeListener
  6. ServletRequestAttributeListener
  7. HttpSessionBindingListener: 监测何时随着HttpSession绑定和解绑
  8. HttpSessionActivationListener: 监测何时随着HttpSession激活和钝化

entry.title: Roman to Integer
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Roman to Integer.

Description

Given a roman numeral, convert it to an integer.

Input is guaranteed to be within the range from 1 to 3999.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1:

  1. The character which is greater precede the smaller one, add the original number. Otherwise, add the number which minus previous one.
  2. Using Switch method to choose the right number to add based on the different character ordering.

Solution2:

  1. Maintain previous pointer and current pointer, if current element is less than previous one, add it.
  2. Otherwise, minus the previous one and add the difference of current and previous element.

entry.title: Day12 JAVA Key Words
entry.content:
本篇是关于Java各种关键字的区别。

攻略模板

  • 回忆关键字特性
  • 总结关键字特性，并总结用法

自己回忆

  • private , protected, public: private 只有当前class内可见，protected当前class,subclass和一个package下可见，public所有可见。
  • Interface and Abstract class: Interface的方法不用具体实现，默认是public的方法，如果有成员变量也默认为 public， Abstact class中方法需要具体实现，用abstract 关键字来区别是否为abstract method,可以有非abstact得方法和成员变量。
  • extnds and implement: extends一个abstact class，implement多个interface
  • static用法：static可以在创建new instance of class 前直接调用。
  • final：定义后的变量初次赋值后，不可再变。
  • Polymorphism: 当一个类继承和实现其他抽象类或接口后，该类就具备了其他类所具备的方法
  • Encapsulation: 为了使代码解耦，使得相同功能的代码放在一起，加强代码的利用率。

学习后总结：

class and object

Class is a general concept and the object is a very specific embodiment of that class, with a limited lifespan.

  1. Class: A class is a program construct which encapsulate data and operation on data.
  2. Object: is an actual instance of a class.

Interface and Abstract class

  1. Interface: All methods in interface are implictly abstract. We should implement all the declared methods. A class could implement multiple interface. Members of interface are public and variables are static,final and public by default. (Since interface doesn’t have a direct object, the only way to access them is by using a class/interface and hence that is why if interface variable exists, it should be static otherwise it won’t be accessible at all to outside world. Now since it is static, it can be hold only one value and any classes that implements it can change it and it will be all mess. So it is final)

  2. Abstract class: It’s allowed to have non-abstract methods. So the memeber of abstract class can either be private,protected and public and may contain non-final variables. A class can only extends one abstact class. They may not implement all declared methods, in this case, the subclass must be also declared as an abstract class. An abstract method could be protected or public.

Inner class

A class can be a member of another class, which is an inner class.

Non-static nested classes (inner classes) have access to other members of the enclosing class, even if they are declared private. It is a way of logically grouping classes that are only used in one place: If a class is useful to only one other class, then it is logical to embed it in that class and keep the two together. Nesting such “helper classes” makes their package more streamlined.

It increases encapsulation: Consider two top-level classes, A and B, where B needs access to members of A that would otherwise be declared private. By hiding class B within class A, A’s members can be declared private and B can access them. In addition, B itself can be hidden from the outside world. It can lead to more readable and maintainable code: Nesting small classes within top-level classes places the code closer to where it is used.

Inheritance,Polymorphism,Encapsulation

  1. Inheritance: The ability of a new class to be created, from an existing class by extends it.

  2. Polymorphism: Polymorphism is a generic term that means ‘many shapes’. More precisely means the ability to request that the same operations be performed by a wide range of different types of things.

  3. Encapsulation: is often used as a technique for encouraging decoupling. This is useful because it prevents the external code from being concerned with teh internal workings of an object.

Override and Overload

  1. Override is defined as the case when a child class redefines the same method as a parent class. Override methods must have the same name, argumentlist and return type.

  2. Overload occurs when two or more methods in the same class have the exact same name, but different parameters.

private, protected, public

  1. private: We can only use the private variable in instance class.

  2. protected: Protected variable can be accessed in the same package and subclass.

  3. public: public opens for any scope.

static and static block

  1. Static function have no object to work with since they belong to the class as a whole. You can call a static function without an object.
    So a static function cannot access non-static member variables of class. We cannot use ‘this’ pointer. This pointer is only used when a class is instantiated as an object.

  2. Static block: It’s a static initializer. It’s used when a block of code needs to be executed during loading of the class by JVM. It can be thought of as a “class constructor”. It’s mostly used for changing the default values of static variables. Execute static block first, then execute constructor.

  3. static class: A class can be made static only if it is a nested Class. The nested static class can be accessed without having an object of outer class.

  1. static method: Static mehods and variables can be accessed using class name. In the static method, we can not use non-static variables.

  2. static variable: are known as Class Variables. Such variables get default values based on the data type. Memory allocation only happens once when the class is loaded in memory. Static variables are common for all instances.

final

The instance variable with final keyword can’t be changed. When applied to either class(can not be used as base class to derive any class from it) or method(cann’t be overriden), turns off late binding, and thus prevents polymorphism.

enum and Enumeration

  1. enum is a special data type that enables for a variable to be a set of predefined constants. The variable must be equal to one of the values that have been predefined for it.
  2. Enumeration is an interface. An object that implements the Enumeration interface generates a series of elements, one at a tiem. Successive calls to the ‘nextElement’ method return successive elements of the series.
    For example, to print all elements of a Vector v:

entry.title: Clone Graph
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Clone Graph.

Description

Clone an undirected graph. Each node in the graph contains a label and a list of its neighbors.

OJ’s undirected graph serialization:

Nodes are labeled uniquely.

We use # as a separator for each node, and , as a separator for node label and each neighbor of the node.

As an example, consider the serialized graph {0,1,2#1,2#2,2}.

The graph has a total of three nodes, and therefore contains three parts as separated by #.

  1. First node is labeled as 0. Connect node 0 to both nodes 1 and 2.
  2. Second node is labeled as 1. Connect node 1 to node 2.
  3. Third node is labeled as 2. Connect node 2 to node 2 (itself), thus forming a self-cycle.

Visually, the graph looks like the following:

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. Use BFS
  2. Queue + HashMap
  3. In HashMap, key is label, value is new Object. So each time we clone each node through HashMap.

Solution2

  1. Use DFS + Recursive Solution
  2. If node is empty, return null.
  3. If there is already the node in HashMap, return it.
  4. Else traverse neighbor nodes, clone it and store it into HashMap and recursively add new node into its neighbors.

entry.title: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree.

Description

Given a binary tree, find the lowest common ancestor (LCA) of two given nodes in the tree.

According to the definition of LCA on Wikipedia: “The lowest common ancestor is defined between two nodes v and w as the lowest node in T that has both v and w as descendants (where we allow a node to be a descendant of itself).”

For example, the lowest common ancestor (LCA) of nodes 5 and 1 is 3. Another example is LCA of nodes 5 and 4 is 5, since a node can be a descendant of itself according to the LCA definition.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution.

  1. If search from root and find two target nodes in different sides. Then the LCA is root.
  2. If find two nodes in left subtree, then recursively search from the left of root.
  3. If find two nodes in right subtree, then recursively search from the right of root.

Solution2: Recursive solution.

  1. If root is null, return null
  2. If root is one of two nodes, return root.
  3. Recurseively traverse left subtree and right subtree.
  4. If both left subtree and right subtree get the specific node, then return root.
  5. If one of subtree is null, return another subtree.

Solution3: Iterative solution.

  1. Use List to record the path which find from root to the specific nodes.
  2. Compare elements from two lists and get the last common elements.

entry.title: Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder Traversal
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder Traversal .

Description

Given preorder and inorder traversal of a tree, construct the binary tree.

Note:
You may assume that duplicates do not exist in the tree.

Solution

Analysis

Solution: Iterative solution.

  1. PreOrder: root is the first element in the array and use this element to divide inorder array.
  2. InOrder: the left array of the root is left subtree and the right array of the root is right subtree.We can get the size of left subtree and right subtree and use for the preorder array. Use this size to divide preorder array and build tree.

entry.title: Balanced Binary Tree
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Balanced Binary Tree.

Description

Given a binary tree, determine if it is height-balanced.

For this problem, a height-balanced binary tree is defined as a binary tree in which the depth of the two subtrees of every node never differ by more than 1.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution.

Time complexity is O(nlogn).

  1. if tree is null, return true;
  2. if the difference of left subtree and right subtree is greater than 1, return false;
  3. recursively compare left subtree and right subtree loop 1 and 2.

Solution2: Recursive solution.

Time complexity is O(n)

  1. Get the depth of left subtree and right subtree from bottom to the top.
  2. Once the difference of two depth is greater than 1, it will always return -1 and there is no need to compare any more. If not, return its depth for the father node.

entry.title: Same Tree
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Same Tree.

Description

Given two binary trees, write a function to check if they are equal or not.

Two binary trees are considered equal if they are structurally identical and the nodes have the same value.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution.

  1. if two nodes are null, return true;
  2. if the value of two nodes are equivalent, recursively compare their left and right subtree.
  3. else return false.

Solution2: Iterative solution.

  1. Traverse two trees and compare each nodes.
  2. Use Pre-Order traversal.

entry.title: Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Binary Tree Level Order Traversal.

Description

Given a binary tree, flatten it to a linked list in-place.

For example,
Given

The flattened tree should look like:

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution. Like post-order solution.

  1. if tree is null, return.
  2. if tree is not null, Recursively traverse left subtree and then right subtree, change the left subtree to the right and the original right subtree as the most right node.

Solution2: Iterative solution.

  1. Each time, make the right subtree of root to be the right subtree of most right node of left child node of root.
  2. Then make the left subtree as the right subtree of the root, move to the next right node, loop 1 and 2.

entry.title: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Binary Tree Level Order Traversal.

Description:

Given a binary tree, return the level order traversal of its nodes’ values. (ie, from left to right, level by level).

For example:
Given binary tree [3,9,20,null,null,15,7],

return its level order traversal as:

Solution:

Analysis:

Solution1: Recursive solution.

  1. if the tree is null, return.
  2. if the tree is not null, compare if the size of lists equals to the level. If yes, directly add current node into lists.get(level). If no, create a new list into lists.
  3. Recursively traverse left subtree and right subtree and the level+1.

Solution2: Iterative solution.

  1. Use BFS.
  2. For each loop, we add them together into a new List.

entry.title: Binary Tree Postorder Traversal
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Binary Tree Postorder Traversal.

Description

Given a binary tree, return the inorder traversal of its nodes’ values.

For example:
Given binary tree {1,#,2,3},

return [3,2,1].

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution.

  1. if the tree is null, return.
  2. if the tree is not null, traverse left subtree, traverse right subtree, visit root and add the value of root into list.

Solution2: Iterative solution.

  1. Keep two stacks
  2. Use the way similar to Preorder traversal, preorder is：self, left, right, change its order to self, right, left, then converse to left, right, self

Solution3: Iterative solution.

  1. Only one stack. similar to preorder traversal(iterative solution), push root into stack first, then push right subnode and then left subnode.
  2. There are two situations we need pop node from stack to the list. One is the left subnode and right subnode of the current node is null. Another is the left subtree and right subtree have been visited.

entry.title: Binary Tree Inorder Traversal
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Binary Tree Inorder Traversal.

Description

Given a binary tree, return the inorder traversal of its nodes’ values.

For example:
Given binary tree {1,#,2,3},

return [1,3,2].

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution.

  1. if the tree is null, return.
  2. if the tree is not null, traverse left subtree, visit root and add the value of root into list, and then right subtree.

Solution2: Iterative solution.

  1. Utilize Stack, traverse left subtree of the root to the left most node and push them into stack.
  2. If left subtree is null, pop() one node from stack and record its value into list. Visit the right subtree of this node once, and then repeat 1 and 2 operation.
  3. Notice: here is a tricky point. Since traverse left subtree of the root, there is no need to traverse left subtree again for the node which pop from the stack. Therefore, we need have two nodes. One assigns to the node pop from stack. One assigns to the new node which we find when we traverse right subtree of someone. Traverse left subtree only for the second node.

entry.title: Binary Tree Preorder Traversal
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Binary Tree Preorder Traversal.

Description

Given a binary tree, return the preorder traversal of its nodes’ values.

For example:
Given binary tree {1,#,2,3},

return [1,2,3].

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution.

  1. if the tree is null, return.
  2. if the tree is not null, visit root and add the value of root into list. Traverse left subtree and then right subtree.

Solution2: Recursive solution.

The similar way with solution1, but without helper() method.

Solution3: Iterative solution.

  1. Utilize Stack, Each time we use List to store the output node from stack.
  2. Traverse the output node from right to left and push into stack.
  3. Loop 1 and 2 operation.

entry.title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Maximum Depth of Binary Tree.

Description

Given a binary tree, find its maximum depth.

The maximum depth is the number of nodes along the longest path from the root node down to the farthest leaf node.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Recursive solution.

  1. if the tree is null, the depth is 0;
  2. if the tree is null, the depth = max(depth of left tree，depth of right tree) + 1

Solution2: Iterative solution.

Utilize BFS, count the levels. It’s the same as the the number of loops.

Solution3: Iterative solution.

Utilize DFS, record the depth of each path and maintain the maximum one until traversal all paths.

entry.title: Day10 Algorithm about Itetation and Recursion
Day9 Algorithm about Binary Tree
entry.content:
本篇是关于二叉树Binary Tree算法的分析和总结。

攻略模板

  • 回忆算法特性
  • 实现算法功能
  • 实战训练使用该算法
  • 总结该算法特点，并总结算法题

自己回忆

  • 一般二叉树的查找可以使用DFS 和 BFS
  • 平衡二叉树可以使用二分法，时间复杂度为O(logn)
  • 二叉树的遍历有先序遍历，中序遍历 和 后序遍历
  • Binary Tree and Binary Search Tree: Each node of BT and BST only allowed two children nodes. What’s more, in BST, left < current < right.

实现算法

在这里我们总结出经典15道二叉树题目：

public int getNodeNumRec(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return 0;
return getNodeNumRec(root.left)+getNodeNumRec(root.right)+1;
}

//Traverse tree use BFS
public int getNodeNum(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return 0;
Queue queue = new ArrayDeque<>();
int count = 0;
queue.add(root);
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
int size = queue.size();
count += size;
for(int i=0;i<size;i++) {
TreeNode node = queue.poll();
if(node.left!=null) queue.add(node.left);
if(node.right!=null) queue.add(node.right);
}
}
return count;
}

public int getDepthRec(TreeNode root) {
if(root==null) retrun 0;
return Math.max(getDepthRec(root.left),getDepthRec(root.right))+1;
}

//Traverse tree use BFS
public int getNodeNum(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return 0;
Queue queue = new LinkedList<>();
int count = 0;
queue.add(root);
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
int size = queue.size();
count++;
for(int i=0;i
1
2
3
4

7
3.前序遍历，中序遍历，后序遍历: preorderTraversalRec, preorderTraversal, inorderTraversalRec, postorderTraversalRec (<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tree_traversal#Pre-order_2>) 
       
LeetCode - 104.Binary Tree Preorder Traversal     
Pre-Order递归解法:  Time O(n)       
(1) 如果二叉树为空，返回      
(2) 如果二叉树不为空，访问根节点,list.add(root.val), 前序遍历左子树，前序遍历右子树

//Solution1: add helper() method
public List preorderTraversalRec(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
helper(list,root);
return list;
}

void helper(List list, TreeNode node) {
if(node==null) return;
list.add(node.val);
helper(list,node.left);
helper(list,node.right);
}

//Solution2
public List preorderTraversalRec(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
if(root == null) return list;
list.add(root.val);
list.addAll(preorderTraversalRec(root.left));
list.addAll(preorderTraversalRec(root.right));
return list;
}

public List preorderTraversal(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
if(root == null) return list;
Stack stack = new Stack<>();
stack.push(root);
while(!stack.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node = stack.pop();
list.add(node.val);
if(node.right!=null)stack.push(node.right);
if(node.left!=null)stack.push(node.left);
}
return list;
}

public List inorderTraversal(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
helper(list, root);
return list;
}

void helper(List list, TreeNode node) {
if(node == null) return;
helper(list, node.left);
list.add(node.val);
helper(list,node.right);
}

public List inorderTraversal(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
if(root == null) return list;
Stack stack = new Stack<>();
stack.push(root);
TreeNode node = root;
while(!stack.isEmpty()) {

    while(node.left!=null) {
        stack.push(node.left);
        node = node.left;
    }
    TreeNode addNode = stack.pop();
    list.add(addNode.val);

    if(addNode.right!=null) {
        stack.push(addNode.right);
        node = addNode.right;
    }    
}
return list;

}

public List postorderTraversalRec(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
helper(list, root);
return list;
}

void helper(List list, TreeNode node) {
if(node == null) return;
helper(list, node.left);
helper(list, node.right);
list.add(node.val);
}

//Solution1: Two stack
public List postorderTraversal(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
if(root == null) return list;
Stack stack = new Stack<>();
Stack reverseStack = new Stack<>();
stack.push(root);
while(!stack.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node = stack.pop();
reverseStack.push(node);
if(node.left!=null) stack.push(node.left);
if(node.right!=null) stack.push(node.right);
}
while(!reverseStack.isEmpty()) {
list.add(reverseStack.pop());
}
return list;
}

//Solution2:
public List postorderTraversal(TreeNode root) {
List list = new ArrayList<>();
if(root == null) return list;
Stack stack = new Stack<>();
stack.push(root);
TreeNode prev = null;
while(!stack.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node = stack.peek();
//node.left==null && node.right==null表明node为叶节点
//prev!=null && prev==node.left 表明左子树遍历完，右子树为空
//prev!=null && prev==node.right 表明右子树遍历完
//prev!=node.left&&prev!=node.right表明stack已经连续输出节点到另一分支
if((node.left==null && node.right==null)||(prev!=null && (prev == node.left || prev==node.right))) {
node = stack.pop();
list.add(node.val);
prev = node;
}else {
if(node.right!=null) stack.push(node.right);
if(node.left!=null) stack.push(node.left);
}
}
return list;
}

public List<List<Integer>> levelOrder(TreeNode root) {
    List<List<Integer>> lists = new ArrayList<>();
    helper(lists, root,0);
    return lists;
}
void helper(List<List<Integer>> lists, TreeNode node, int level) {
    if(node == null) return;
    //add a new list to the new level of nodes
    if(lists.size() == level) lists.add(new ArrayList<Integer>());
    List<Integer> temp = lists.get(level);
    temp.add(node.val);
    helper(lists, node.left,level+1);
    helper(lists, node.right,level+1);

}

//Traverse tree use BFS
public void levelTraversal(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return 0;
Queue queue = new LinkedList<>();
queue.add(root);
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
int size = queue.size();
for(int i=0;i<size;i++) {
TreeNode node = queue.poll();
if(node.left!=null) queue.add(node.left);
if(node.right!=null) queue.add(node.right);
}
}
}

public void flatten(TreeNode root) {
    if(root == null) return;

    flatten(root.left);
    flatten(root.right);

    TreeNode right = root.right;
    root.right = root.left;
    root.left = null;
    TreeNode cur = root;
    while(cur.right!=null) cur = cur.right;
    cur.right = right;

}

public void flatten(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return;
while(root!=null) {
if(root.left==null){
root = root.right;
continue;
}
TreeNode left = root.left;
while(left.right!=null) {
left = left.right;
}
left.right = root.right;
root.right = root.left;
root.left = null;
}

}

public int getNodeNumKthLevel(TreeNode root, int k) {
if(root == null || k==0) return 0;
if(k==1) return 1;
return getNodeNumKthLevel(root.left,k-1) + getNodeNumKthLevel(root.right,k-1);
}

//Traverse tree use BFS
public int getNodeNumKthLevel(TreeNode root, int k) {
if(root == null) return 0;
Queue queue = new LinkedList<>();
int count = 0;
queue.add(root);
int result = 0;
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
int size = queue.size();
if(–k == 0){
result = size;
break;
}
for(int i=0;i<size;i++) {
TreeNode node = queue.poll();
if(node.left!=null) queue.add(node.left);
if(node.right!=null) queue.add(node.right);
}
}
return result;
}

public int getNodeNumLeafRec(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return 0;
if(root.right==null && root.left==null) return 1;
return getNodeNumLeafRec(root.left) + getNodeNumLeafRec(root.right);
}

//Traverse tree use BFS
public int getNodeNumKthLevel(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return 0;
Queue queue = new LinkedList<>();
int count = 0;
queue.add(root);
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
int size = queue.size();
for(int i=0;i<size;i++) {
TreeNode node = queue.poll();
if(node.left==null && node.right==null)count++;
if(node.left!=null) queue.add(node.left);
if(node.right!=null) queue.add(node.right);
}
}
return count;
}

public boolean isSameTree(TreeNode p, TreeNode q) {
    if(p==null && q==null) return true;
    if(p==null || q==null) return false;
    if(p.val!=q.val) return false;
    if(p.val==q.val) return isSameTree(p.left,q.left)&&isSameTree(p.right,q.right);
}

public boolean isSameTree(TreeNode p, TreeNode q) { if(p==null && q==null) return true;
if(p==null || q==null) return false;
Stack s1 = new Stack<>();
Stack s2 = new Stack<>();
s1.push(p);
s2.push(q);
while(!s1.isEmpty() && !s2.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node1 = s1.pop();
TreeNode node2 = s2.pop();
if(node1==null && node2==null) continue;
if(node1!=null && node2!=null && node1.val==node2.val) {
s1.push(node1.left);
s1.push(node1.right);
s2.push(node2.left);
s2.push(node2.right);
} else {
return false;
}
}
return true;
}

public boolean isBalanced(TreeNode root) {
    if(root==null) return true;
    if(Math.abs(getDepth(root.left)-getDepth(root.right))>1) return false;
    return isBalanced(root.left) && isBalanced(root.right);
}

int getDepth(TreeNode node) {
    if(node==null) return 0;
    return Math.max(getDepth(node.left),getDepth(node.right))+1;
}

public boolean isBalanced(TreeNode root) { if(getDepth(root)==-1) return false;
return true;
}

int getDepth(TreeNode node) {
    if(node==null) return 0;

    int leftDepth = getDepth(node.left);
    if(leftDepth==-1) return -1;

    int rightDepth = getDepth(node.right);
    if(rightDepth==-1) return -1;

    int diff = Math.abs(leftDepth-rightDepth);
    if(diff>1) {
        return -1;
    } else {
        return Math.max(leftDepth,rightDepth) + 1;
    }
}

public TreeNode mirrorRec(TreeNode root) {
    if(root==null) return null;
    TreeNode left = mirrorRec(root.left);
    TreeNode right = mirrorRec(root.right);
    root.right = left;
    root.left = right;
    return root;
}

public TreeNode mirror(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return null;
Queue queue = new LinkedList<>();
queue.add(root);
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node = queue.poll();
if(node.left==null && node.right==null) continue;
TreeNode left = node.left;
node.left = node.right;
node.right = left;
if(node.left!=null) queue.add(node.left);
if(node.right!=null) queue.add(node.right);

}
return root;

}

public TreeNode mirrorCopyRec(TreeNode root) {
    if(root==null) return null;    
    TreeNode newRoot = new TreeNode(root.val);
    newRoot.left = mirrorRec(root.right);
    newRoot.right = mirrorRec(root.left);
    return newRoot;
}

public TreeNode mirror(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return null;
Stack stack = new Stack<>();
Stack newStack = new Stack<>();
stack.push(root);
TreeNode newRoot = new TreeNode(root.val);
newStack.push(newRoot);
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node = stack.pop();
TreeNode newNode = newStack.pop();
if(node.left!=null) {
stack.push(node.left);
newNode.rihgt = newTreeNode(node.left.val);
stack.push(newNode.right);
}
if(node.right!=null) {
stack.push(node.right);
newNode.left = newTreeNode(node.right.val);
stack.push(newNode.left);
}
}
return newRoot;
}

public boolean isMirrorRec(TreeNode p, TreeNode q) {
    if(p==null && q==null) return true; 
    if(p==null || q==null) return false;
    if(p.val != q.val) return false;
    return isMirrorRec(p.left,q.right) && isMirrorRec(p.right,q.left);
}

public boolean isMirror(TreeNode p, TreeNode q) {
if(p == null && q==null) return true;
if(p == null || q==null) return false;
Stack stack1 = new Stack<>();
Stack stack2 = new Stack<>();
stack1.push(p);
stack2.push(q);
while(!p.isEmpty()&&!q.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node1 = stack1.pop();
TreeNode node2 = stack2.pop();
if(node1.val != node.val) return false;
if((node1.left==null&&node2.rihgt!=null)||(node1.left!=null&&node2.rihgt==null)) return false;
if(node1.left!=null && node2.right!=null) {
stack1.push(node1.left);
stack2.push(node2.right);
}
if((node1.rihgt==null&&node2.left!=null)||(node1.right!=null&&node2.left==null)) return false;
if(node1.rihgt!=null && node2.left!=null) {
stack1.push(node1.right);
stack2.push(node2.left);
}
}
return true;
}

//Solution1:
public TreeNode getLastCommonParentRec(TreeNode root, TreeNode p, TreeNode q) {
    if(findNode(root.left,p)) {
        if(findNode(root.left,q)) {
            return getLastCommonParentRec(root.left,p,q);
        }else {
            return root;
        }
    }else {
        if(findNode(root.right,q)) {
            return getLastCommonParentRec(root.right,p,q);
        }else {
            return root;
        }
    }
}

boolean findNode(TreeNode root, TreeNode node) {
    if(root==null || node==null) return false;

    if(root==node) return true;

    boolean found = findNode(root.left,node);
    if(!found) {
        found = findNode(root.right,node);
    }
    return found;
}

//Solution2:
public TreeNode getLastCommonParentRec(TreeNode root, TreeNode p, TreeNode q) {
if(root==null) return null;
if(root==p || root==q) return root;
TreeNode commonLeft = getLastCommonParentRec(root.left,p,q);
TreeNode commonRight = getLastCommonParentRec(root.right,p,q);
if(commonLeft!=null && commonRight!=null) return root;
if(commonLeft!=null) return commonLeft;
return commonRight;
}

public TreeNode getLastCommonParentRec(TreeNode root, TreeNode p, TreeNode q) {
ArrayList list1 = new ArrayList<>();
ArrayList list2 = new ArrayList<>();
boolean found1 = findPath(root,p,list1);
boolean found2 = findPath(root,q,list2);
if(!found1 || !found2) return null;

TreeNode result = null;
for(int i=0;i<Math.min(list1.size(),list2.size());i++) {
    if(list1.get(i)==list2.get(i)){
        result = list1.get(i);
    }else break;
}
return result;

}

boolean findPath(TreeNode root, TreeNode node, ArrayList list) {
if(root==null || node==null) return false;
list.add(root);
if(root == node) return true;
boolean found = findPath(root.left,node,list);
if(!found) {
found = findPath(root.right,node,list);
}
if(!found) list.remove(root);
return found;
}

public int getMaxDistanceRec(TreeNode root) {
Distance dis = getDistance(root);
return dis.maxDistance;
}

private Distance getDistance(TreeNode node) {
//最底一层，深度为0
if(node==null){
Distance empty = new Distance(0,-1);
return empty;
}

Distance left = getDistance(node.left);
Distance right = getDistance(node.right);

Distance dis = new Distance();
dis.maxDepth = Math.max(left.maxDepth,right.maxDepth)+1;
dis.maxDistance = Math.max(left.maxDepth+right.maxDepth+2,Math.max(left.maxDistance,right.maxDistance));
return dis;

}

class Distance {
int maxDistance;
int maxDepth;
public Distance(){}
public Distance(int maxDistance,int maxDepth){
this.maxDistance = maxDistance;
this.maxDepth = maxDepth;
}
}

public TreeNode rebuildBinaryTreeRec(int[]preorder,int[]inorder) {
return buildTree(preorder,0,preorder.length-1,inorder,0,inorder.length-1);
}

TreeNode buildTree(int[]preorder,int preStart, int preEnd, int[]inorder, int inStart, int inEnd) {
if(preStart > preEnd) return null;
int rootVal = preorder[preStart];
int inRoot=-1;
for(int i=inStart,j=inEnd; i<=j; i++,j–) {
if(inorder[i] == rootVal) {
inRoot = i;
break;
}else if(inorder[j] == rootVal){
inRoot = j;
break;
}
}
TreeNode root = new TreeNode(rootVal);
root.left = buildTree(preorder,preStart+1,preStart+(inRoot-inStart), inorder,inStart,inRoot-1);
root.right = buildTree(preorder,preEnd-(inEnd-inRoot)+1,preEnd,inorder,inRoot+1,inEnd);
return root;
}

public boolean isCompleteBinaryTree(TreeNode root) {
if(root == null) return false;
Queue queue = new Queue<>();
queue.add(root);
boolean flag = true;
while(!queue.isEmpty()) {
TreeNode node = queue.poll();
if(flag) {
if(node.left==null && node.right==null) flag = false;
else if(node.left==null && node.right!=null) return false;
else if(node.left!=null && node.right==null) {
flag = false;
queue.add(node.left);
}else {
queue.add(node.left);
queue.add(node.right);
}

    }else {
        if(node.left!=null || node.right!=null) return false;
    }
}
return true;

}

  • Root
    • A
      • B
      • C
    • D
      • E
      • F
        -G

For example, you have a BST of a list of number, inorder traversal would print them out in ascending order.

+

/ \
A *
/ \
B C

Output: A + B * C

If you want to evaluate the expression, you traverse the tree in postorder, applying each operator to the values from each of its sub-trees.

public void traversal(TreeNode root) {
if(roo==null) return;

traversal(root.left);

traversal(root.right);

}

public ResultType traversal(TreeNode root) {
if(root==null) {
return null;
}

//Divide
ResultType left = traversal(root.left);
ResultType right = traversal(root.right);

//Conquer
ResultType result = Merge from left to right
return result;

}

```

How to think over Divide&Conquer

entry.title: Two Sum II - Input array is sorted
entry.content:

Analysis

Solution1 and 2

Based on Two Sum solution, and add pruning solution.

Solution3

  1. Keep two pointers. One moves from head and another moves from tail.

  3. If the sum of two values is less than target, move first pointer to the right.

Solution4

  2. Time complexity is O(nlogn), space complexity is O(1).

entry.title: Happy Number
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Happy Number.

Description

Write an algorithm to determine if a number is “happy”.

A happy number is a number defined by the following process: Starting with any positive integer, replace the number by the sum of the squares of its digits, and repeat the process until the number equals 1 (where it will stay), or it loops endlessly in a cycle which does not include 1. Those numbers for which this process ends in 1 are happy numbers.

Example: 19 is a happy number

1^2 + 9^2 = 82
8^2 + 2^2 = 68
6^2 + 8^2 = 100
1^2 + 0^2 + 0^2 = 1

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. Use HashSet to store all sum in each loop
  2. If the sume is 1, then it is happy number. Ohterwise store in HashSet and if the specific element is already in HashSet, this is not happy number.
  3. Space complexity is O(n)

Solution2

  1. Space complexity is O(1), much faster.
  2. Adapt the Floyd Cycle detection algorithm.

entry.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters.

Description

Given a string, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.

Examples:

Given "abcabcbb", the answer is "abc", which the length is 3.

Given "bbbbb", the answer is "b", with the length of 1.

Given "pwwkew", the answer is "wke", with the length of 3. Note that the answer must be a substring, "pwke" is a subsequence and not a substring.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. Iterate through the string, store its character and index into HashMap.
  2. If there is a existed key, then record the size of hashmap which is the length of substringand compare to get the maximum one.
  3. remove all elements which are before this existed key(inclusive this element)
  4. store this new element and continue to the next one.
  5. At last return the maximum one from max and the size of hashmap.
  6. The time complexity is O(n^2)

Solution2

  1. Iterate through the string, store its character and index into HashMap.
  2. Keep two pointers. Utilize right pointer to scan through string and left pointer move to the right of the same character last found if possible. Note that boty pointers only move forward.
  3. The length between two pointers is the result.
  4. The time complexity is O(n)

Solution3

  1. Use Array instead of HashMap
  2. Initiate Array with -1 in order that left pointer move from the first location.
  3. Store location in Array based on the index of character.

自己回忆

  • HashSet: only store value and in random order. It doesn’t allow to duplicate value in the hashset.
  • TreeSet: It’s ordered set.

实现数据结构

HashSet’s internal implementation is based on HashMap.

学习后总结

HashSet vs. TreeSet

  • HashSet: 所有操作都是O(1),only allow unique element in HashSet. allowed null value. not thread-safe. If multiple threads access to the hashset, at least one thread modify set, it must be synchronized externally or use Collections.synchronizedSet() method. HashSet is faster than TreeSet.
  • TreeSet: 所有操作都是O(logn),duplicate-free collection of elements. not allowed null value. The default order is natural ordering. offers some handy method like first(),last().
  • LinkedHashSet: It provides insertion-ordered iteration.
Property HashSet LinkedHashSet TreeSet
Order no guarantee order insertion order sorted according comparison mechanism(comparator),the default is natural ordering
add/remove/contains/size O(1) O(1) O(logn)
Interfaces Set Set Set,SortedSet,NavigableSet
Null values/keys allowed allowed not allowed(will throw NullPointerException)
Fail-fast behavior Will throw ConcurrentModificationException Will throw ConcurrentModificationException Will throw ConcurrentModificationException
Implementation HashMap HashMap Red-Black Tree
Is sunchronized No No No

entry.title: Day7 DataStructure about Map
entry.content:
本篇是关于Map的原理与应用.

攻略模板

  • 回忆数据结构：分析数据结构特性，比较类似数据结构差异
  • 实现数据结构
  • 实战训练使用该数据结构
  • 总结该数据结构特点，并总结算法题

自己回忆

  • HashMap: key不能重复，value可以重复，只能存储wrapper class，not primitive type. Not thread-safe. It is faster than hashtable.
  • Hashtable: Thread-safe. Others are similar to HashMap.
  • ConcurrentHashMap: It’s thread-safe.
  • TreeMap: It’s ordered map.

实现数据结

HashMap works on the principal of hashing.
HashMap stores both key+value pair in every node of linked list.

  • How do get() and put() method of HashMap work: As we put(key,value) to store key-value pairs into the hashmap, HashMap implementation calls hashcode() on Key object to calculate a hash that is used to find a bucket where entry(key and value) will be stored. When get() method is used to retrieve value, again key objects is used to calculate the hash then to find the bucket where that particular key is stored.
  • Collision: Two different keys with the same hash value.
  • What will happen if two different objects have same hashcode: Since hashcode() is same, bucket location would be same and collision occurs in hashmap. Since HashMap uses a linked list to store in bucket, object(both key and value) will be stored in next node of linked list.
  • How did you retrieve if two different objects have same hashcode: After finding bucket location through the hashcode(via key), we will call keys equals() method to identify correct node in linked list and return the associated value object for that key.
  • How to reduce collision: Using immutable, final obejct with proper equals() and hashcode() implementation wolud act as perfect JAVA HashMap keys and improve performance. Since immutablity also allows caching their hashcode of different keys which makes overall retrieval process very fast.
  • The performance of get() method when collision happen: Using equals() method to compare keys to find out the correct object within a linked-list. The complexity is O(n). If hash will change from using a linked list to a balanced tree. This will improve to O(logn).

特别注意：

学习后总结：

HashMap vs. Hashtable

  • HashMap: It’s not synchronized so it’s faster and takes less memory than Hashtable. It allows one null key and any number of null values.
  • Hashtable: It’s synchronized so it’s thread-safe. It doesn’t allow null keys or values.

ConcurrentHashMap vs. Hashtable

  • ConcurrentHashMap provides its own synchronization, so you don’t have to synchronize access to it explicitly. It provides putIfAbsent method and this ensure to atomically add a mapping if the specific key does’t exist.
  • The difference between ConcurrentHashMap and Hashtable:

ConcurrentHashMap uses a lock striping strategy: It uses mutiple locks on segment level instead of object level. It has(with defalut setting) 16 locks, each guarding 1/16th of the hashmap buckets. In this way, multiple threads can get/put key-value pairs from ConcurrentHashMap without blocking/waiting for each other. (just like it locks each room instead of main door)
Hashtable and Collections.synchronizedMap(): It uses single lock for entire map. It means if multiple threads try to access to it at the same time, it only allows one thread to access to it. (it locks home’s main door)

  • How to make HashMap thread safe: You can make HashMap thread safe by wrapping it with Collections.synchronizedMap(). Or use lock explicitly.
Property HashMap Hashtable ConcurrentHashMap
Null values/keys One null key, any number of null values not allowed not allowed
Is thread-safe No Yes Yes
Lock mechanism not applicable locks entire map(locks the object) locks the portion of map(locks the bucket)
Iterator fail-fast fail-fast fail-safe

LinkedHashMap vs. TreeMap

  • TreeMap: It’s a tree based mapping. Its put/get operations take O(log n) time. It requires items to have some comparison mechanism, either with Comparable or Comparator. The iteration order is determined by this mechanism(so the default ordering is natural ordering).
  • LinkedHashMap: It’s based on HashMap and Linked List, but it adds awareness to the order at which items are added. So the iteration order is the same as insertion order.
Property HashMap LinkedHashMap TreeMap
Order no guarantee order insertion order sorted according comparison mechanism(the default is natural ordering)
Get/put/remove/containsKey O(1) O(1) O(logn)
Interfaces Map Map Map,NavigableMap,SortedMap
Null values/keys allowed allowed only values
Fail-fast behavior Will throw ConcurrentModificationException Will throw ConcurrentModificationException Will throw ConcurrentModificationException
Implementation buckets doble-linked bukets Red-Black Tree
Is sunchronized No No No

HashMap的方法

  • values() 返回所有值（value）的集合，是一个Collection
  • keySet() 返回所有键（key）的集合，是一个set集合，遍历这个set，用get()获取key所对应的value，也就遍历了Map
  • entrySet() 返回一个Set集合，在set集合中存放的是Map.Entry类型的对象，每个Entry代表Map的one pair(key,value)

遍历HashMap的两种方法：

entry.title: Implement Stack using Queues
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Implement Stack using Queues.

Description

Implement the following operations of a stack using queues.

  • push(x) – Push element x onto stack.
  • pop() – Removes the element on top of the stack.
  • top() – Get the top element.
  • empty() – Return whether the stack is empty.

Notes:

  • You must use only standard operations of a queue – which means only push to back, peek/pop from front, size, and is empty operations are valid.
  • Depending on your language, queue may not be supported natively. You may simulate a queue by using a list or deque (double-ended queue), as long as you use only standard operations of a queue.
  • You may assume that all operations are valid (for example, no pop or top operations will be called on an empty stack).

Update (2015-06-11):
The class name of the Java function had been updated to MyStack instead of Stack.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Two Queue

check the first queue firstly, then the second if necessary. Since the first queue has higher priority to own the target. Push all elements except the last one from one queue to another. Return the last one.

Solution2

Each time when we push an element, we rotate the queue to make the tail be the head.

entry.title: Implement Queue using Stacks
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Implement Queue using Stacks.

Description

Implement the following operations of a queue using stacks.

  • push(x) – Push element x to the back of queue.
  • pop() – Removes the element from in front of queue.
  • peek() – Get the front element.
  • empty() – Return whether the queue is empty.

Notes:

  • You must use only standard operations of a stack – which means only push to top, peek/pop from top, size, and is empty operations are valid.
  • Depending on your language, stack may not be supported natively. You may simulate a stack by using a list or deque (double-ended queue), as long as you use only standard operations of a stack.
  • You may assume that all operations are valid (for example, no pop or peek operations will be called on an empty queue).

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  • push: make sure the second stack is empty and push it into first stack.
  • pop: make sure the first stack is empty and pop from the second stack.
  • peek: the same rule with pop.

Solution2

  • push: push it into first stack.
  • peek: if second stack is not empty, pop from it. Otherwise, put all elements from the first stack to the second stack and the peek it.
  • pop: the similar operation with peek and at last pop it.

entry.title: Day6 DataStructure Collection
entry.content:
本篇是关于Collection的各种数据结构的分析和对比.

攻略模板

  • 回忆数据结构：分析数据结构特性，比较类似数据结构差异
  • 实现数据结构
  • 实战训练使用该数据结构
  • 总结该数据结构特点，并总结算法题

自己回忆

  • Collections and Arrays: 都可以快速调用实现sort功能
  • Queue: First in first out.
  • Stack: First in last out.

实现数据结构

学习后总结

Collections vs. Arrays

  • Collections: Collections.sort(list) , 它是专门operates on List排序。使用的算法为TimSort(modified by MergeSort) and ensure it’s stable.
  • Arrays: Arrays.sort(array) , 它是专门为operates on Array排序。使用的算法为QucikSort for primitive type(not stable). TimSort for objects(stable). Actually, java.util.Collections.sort() simply calls java.util.Arrays.sort() to do the heavy lifting.

Queue vs. Stack

  • Queue is an interface, if you want to get this collection, you need a specific implementing class, like LinkedList or ArrayDeque.
  • Stack is a class. It implements List.
  • operation:

Stack:

  • pop() 删去element at the top(head/first) of stack and return. Throws EmptyStackException if the stack is empty.
  • push() 存入element at the top(head/first) of stack.
  • peek() 取出element at the top(head/first) of stack. Throws EmptyStackException if the stack is empty.

Queue:

  • boolean add() vs. boolean offer() : insert the element into the tail(end/last) of the queue. add() throws an IllegalStateException if no space is available.
  • poll() 删去element at the top(head/first) of stack and return, return null if queue is empty.
  • peek() 取出element at the top(head/first) of stack, return null if the queue is empty.
  • empty() 返回if queue is empty.

Deque:

  • addFirst(), offerFirst()
  • addLast(), offerLast()
  • pollFirst(), peekFirst()
  • pollLast(),peekLast()
  • removeFirst(), removeLast()

ArrayDeque vs. LinkedList

Both implement Deque and Queue.

  • Memory cost: ArrayDeque is memory efficient since you don’t have to keep track of next node unlike in LinkedList.

  • Accessing speed: Accessing an element in ArrayDeque is always faster than LinkedList. It takes O(1) for accessing elements. In Linked List, it will take O(n) to find last element.

  • ArrayDeque: This class is likely to be faster than Stack when used as a stack, and faster than LinkedList when used as a queue. It doesn’t support null elements and concurrent access by multiple threads and is not thread-safe.

entry.title: Day5 Class Design
entry.content:
本篇是关于Class Design方面的一些注意事项和总结。

攻略模板

  • 回忆内部结构：分析设计类的特性和步骤
  • 学习、探究和提出细节问题
  • 解惑、总结及训练

自己回忆

在定义一个custom类时，需要根据已有的数据结构，来获得自己想要的方法，并构建外部可以调用的方法，而封装内部的具体实现和结构。
比如：实现一个双端链表，并且该链表可以把链表尾部指定个数的元素累加一定的值

学习过程和疑问

在上述的程序里，我们有以下几个疑问：

  1. 如何构建一个类，如何在一个类中定义自己的constructor， Override 和 Overload应用。
  2. 如何构建自己的外部方法，封装内部结构。
  3. Deque stack = new LinkedList<>(); 定义的意义，为什么声明和具体实现对象的不同的做法.
  4. 如何设计一个扩展性强的通用class，还是把业务逻辑写在custom class中更好。

总结

When do we use ‘this’ keyword in the class?

  • We commonly pass an argument with the same name as the private member variable we are attempting to set, we need use this to disambiguate variable references.
  • When accessing an outer instance from a nested non-static class:

Why do we use private for member variable?

  • 防止外界对象对内部成员变量的影响， a public member can be accessed from outside the class. If something goes wrong, the culprit can be anywhere, and so in order to track down the bug, you may have to look at quite a lot of code.
  • 解耦Encapsulation and Decoupling. If you change the member variable in A class, we need to check usages of this variable in B class which we use it in B.

Why do we use private, Get and Set Method instead of direct access to the information?

It is bad to let external objects direct access to the informaiton. If you don’t want other objects to access the internal data, but wish to controll it. You woould make it either private or protected, but provide get and set functions which can manipulate the data in a controlled way.

Because in the get and set functions, we can filter the invalid data and modification.

For example:

We have declared our string and integer to be public. This means that any object in the system can change the balance (setting it to zero, or even giving us a negative balance). This could cause the program to fall over, even though we wrote code in our constructor to prevent negative balances.

Instead, we should have provided a getBalance/setBalance method, and made our balance private or proteced. Other objects can still access the data, but they can’t put invalid data in.

如何构建自己的外部方法，封装内部结构

  1. 可以借用其他已有的数据结构，去实现一个custom data structure.
  2. 其他人不用去知道你到底使用了什么数据结构，你只需要定义自己的private member variable, 去开放想让别人知道的方法和接口 public function.
  3. This can make a good encapsulation and coupling.

如何构建一个类，如何在一个类中定义自己的constructor, Overload vs. Override

  1. Declare the private member variables in the class and then concrete them in the constructor if necessary.
  2. So you can have various kinds of constructor with initialization. This is the Overload. The same method name but different type and number of parameters. 如果只是改变了return type 或者 the name of parameters, this is not Overload.
  3. Overriding requires the exactly same signature(method name, the type and number of parameters) and return type and thrown exceptions.
  4. Use Get and Set function to let external objects to access the internal data and controll it.

Why to use Polymorphism

Deque<Integer> stack = new LinkedList<>();

The main reason you’d do this is to decouple your code from a specfic implementation of the interface. This is called programming to the interface.

比如: List list = new LinkedList(), 你想改变具体的数据结构，use ArrayList instead of LinkedList, 你仅仅只需要改为List list = new ArrayList()而不需要考虑别的，如果一开始你就使用LinkedList list = new LinkedList(),那么there is no guarantee that the rest of your code doesn’t make use of methods to the LinkedList class.

关于Switch

Switch 不支持 long, float, double 及其包装类， 支持int, char, byte以及包装类和String.

entry.title: Kth Largest Element in an Array
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Kth Largest Element in an Array.

Description

Find the kth largest element in an unsorted array. Note that it is the kth largest element in the sorted order, not the kth distinct element.

For example,
Given [3,2,1,5,6,4] and k = 2, return 5.

Note:
You may assume k is always valid, 1 ≤ k ≤ array’s length.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. sort array and get he kth largest element.
  2. Time O(nlogn), Space O(1)

Solution2

  1. Maintain a PriorityQueue with k size
  2. Put each element into PriorityQueue and get the peek at last.
  3. Time O(nlogk), Space O(k)

Solution3

  1. Turn to find the kth smallest number
  2. Take use of Quick Sort, each time find the position of pivot and get the length between left and pivot
  3. If the length equals to k, it’ll be the right one.
  4. if the length is less than k, loop the next round for right side of list.
  5. if the length is greater than k, loop the next round for left side of list

entry.title: Day4 Difference between Comparator and Comparable
entry.content:
本篇是关于Comparator和Comparable的比较和总结.

攻略模板

  • 回忆内部结构：分析结构特性，比较两者差异
  • 学习、穷解该结构和概念
  • 总结该概念特点，并总结算法题

自己回忆

  • Comparator: interface,可以直接在方法的后面重写和定义。
  • Comparable: interface, 在类中实现并继承。

学习过程

  • Comparable: A comparable object is capable of comparing itself with another object, like a.compareTo(b). The class itself must implement the java.lang.Comparable interface in order to be able to compare its instances. 排序接口，若一个类实现了comparable接口，就意味着“该类支持排序”。相当于一个“内部比较器”。
  • Comparator: A comparator object is capable of comparing two different objects, like compare(a, b). The class is not comparing its instance, but some other class’s instances. The comparator class must implement the java.util.Comparatorinterface. 比较器，我们若需要控制某个类的次序，可以建立一个“该类的比较器”来进行排序。相当于一个“外部比较器”。
  • 关于排序顺序,ascending and descending
  • compare: is from the Comparator interface.
  • compareTo: is from the Comparable interface.

应用PriorityQueue

  • PriorityQueue是利用堆排序Heap sort原理，使用最大堆Max-heap或者最小堆Min-heap，默认最小堆，即每次取出的是最小值，因此每次出队和入队操作不能保证队列元素的有序性，只能保证队头元素和新插入元素的有序性。
    PriorityQueue is implemented as a Binary Heap,both inserting and removing the values through offer() and poll() methods have O(lg K) complexity.

升序排列，即默认情况:

若希望降序排列:

  • 时间复杂度： remove()和add()时间复杂度都为O(logn), remove(Object obj) 和 contains() 需要O(n), 取队头只需要O(1).

entry.title: Day3 Difference between Stack and heap
entry.content:
本篇介绍的是Stack与Heap的区别

攻略模板

  • 回忆内部结构：分析结构特性，比较两者差异
  • 学习、穷解该结构和概念
  • 总结该概念特点，并总结算法题

自己回忆

  • Heap: It will generate a heap in application startup. Put the globle variable and object into it. Will have memory leak.
  • Stack: Every thread will have its own stack. Put the local variable, return address into it. And it is based on the characteristic of stack, Last in first out. It ensures the application get the most recently thread.

学习过程

  • Where are the stack and heap stored : They both are stored in computer’s RAM(Random Access Memory).
  • How do threads interact with them and how do them work in multithreading: Each thread has its own stack and multithreads shared with one heap.
  • How long does memoery on the stack last versus memoery on the heap: In each thread, there are local variables in stack when the function is called and they are deleted automatically when the function end. Since multithreads share with one heap, there are globle variables and objects storing in the heap. And if you want to delete some resource, you need deallocate it manully. For java, there is garbage collection mechanism to automatically delete memoery from the heap. If you don’t delete this object inside the function, it will end up with memory lead.
  • Can the stack and heap grow in size: Stack cannot grow in size. It is fixed when stack is created. If there are much more nested function or infinite recursive call, stack overflow will occur. Heap can grow in size based on the application requirement. When there are large number of data or you’re not sure how much data you need to store, you can store them into heap.
  • Which is faster - the stack or the head: The stack is much faster than the heap. This is because of the way that memory is allocated in the stack. Allocating memory on the stack is as simple as moving the pointer up.
  • What can go wrong with the stack and the heap: If stack runs out of memory, then this is called a stack overflow and could cause the program crash. The heap could have the problem of fragmentation, which occurs when the available memory on the heap is noncontiguous. But allocating new memory may be impossible because of the fact that even through there is enough memory for the desired allocation, there are not enough memoery in one big block for the desiged amount of memory.

学习后总结：

Heap and Stack:

  • 注意点： 只要是new()新建出来的对象，全部存储在heap中。
    Code to create an object on the stack:

So, the object “m” is destroyed once the function has run to completion – or, in other words, when it “goes out of scope”. The memory being used for the object “m” on the stack will be removed once the function is done running.

If we want to create an object on the heap inside a function, then this is what the code would look like:

Code to create an object on the heap:

In the code above, you can see that the “m” object is created inside a function using the “new” keyword. This means that “m” will be created on the heap. But, since “m” is created using the “new” keyword, that also means that we must delete the “m” object on our own as well – otherwise we will end up with a memory leak.

  • 如果在局部new一个对象时，会在stack和heap中都allocate memoery, 在heap中memory实际建立这个对象，在stack中的memory只是一个指向这个heap对象的指针。

  • java中的数据类型，分为基本类型(primitive types)和包装类数据(wrappper class):
    基本类型都存放在stack. Stack有一个很重要的特殊性，就是存在栈中的数据可以共享。举例：
    int a = 3;
    int b = 3;
    　　编译器先处理int a = 3；首先它会在栈中创建一个变量为a的引用，然后查找有没有字面值为3的地址，没找到，就开辟一个存放3这个字面值的地址，然后将a指向3的地址。接着处理int b = 3；在创建完b的引用变量后，由于在栈中已经有3这个字面值，便将b直接指向3的地址。这样，就出现了a与b同时均指向3的情况。

特别注意：这种字面值的引用于类对象的引用不同。 假设两个类对象的引用指向同一个对象，如果一个引用变量修改了这个对象，那么另一个引用也会反映出这个变化。 相反，字面值的引用不会出现这个问题。

关于特殊包装类：String

For s1 and s2, we put “abc” (String literals)into String Constant Pool. It’s not in heap or stack. But the reference of this string is in stack. For the String Constant Pool, if we can find string already exists in String Constant Pool, there is no need to create a new string into the pool. We only make this reference refer to this created String.
For s3 and s4, we new an object, so put this “abc” (Strig object) into heap.

关于 equals and == :

equals is to compare the value of the string, == is to compare if two reference point to the same object.

值传递(pass by value)和引用传递(pass by reference)

Java always pass arguments by value NOT by reference.

简单的就两句话：
1.基本类型：按值传递
2.对象：将引用按值传递

按值传递的特性：传递的是值而不是引用，所以当形参修改时，实参并没有受到影响。

举例：

说明：

总结：

  1. 基本类型如int, long, double, long等，pass by value. 传递给其他形参之后如何修改都不会影响original value.
  2. 对象Object，是对象的引用pass by value，每次改变的是所指向的对象即一直指向不同的对象，除非直接修改该对象的内在成员变量的值，否则不会影响original object.
  3. 数组 跟 object 的情况类似，如果直接修改数组中的值，则会直接影响到。
  4. That’s the reason why we should have a private final in x; when we don’t want the internal member variables are changed.

参考：

  1. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9404625/java-pass-by-reference/9404727#9404727
  2. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40480/is-java-pass-by-reference-or-pass-by-value
  3. http://www.blogjava.net/heis/archive/2009/04/23/267256.html

entry.title: Sort List
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Sort List.

Description

Sort a linked list in O(n log n) time using constant space complexity.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1: Merge sort with recursive way, divide and conquer. First divide the list into left and right lists, sort them and then merge two lists. But the space complexity is O(log n). Because our iteration is O(n), we need iterate logn round. The time complexity is O(nlogn),but space complexity is O(logn).

Solution2: From bottom to top, first sort every two ListNodes, then four nodes until the whole list. Each time we sort in the same list, the space complexity is O(1).

Solution2

Merge Sort. Time complexity is O(nlogn)

entry.title: Day2 Algorithm about Sorting
entry.content:
本篇是关于各种排序算法的分析和总结。

攻略模板

  • 回忆算法特性
  • 实现算法功能
  • 实战训练使用该算法
  • 总结该算法特点，并总结算法题

自己回忆

  • 直接插入排序Insertion sort: 在已有排好的序列中，依次插入新的元素；
  • 希尔排序Shell sort: 每次分成若干组，每组进行直接插入排序，每次缩小组数即扩大组内元素，例如第一次每隔五个分为一组，第二次每隔三个分为一组，第三次每隔一个分为一组；
  • 简单选择排序Selection sort:选择序列中最大的数放在第一位，之后再比较除第一位外剩下所有元素，选出最大数放在第二位，以此类推完成排序；
  • 堆排序Heap sort: 构建最大堆，每次取出堆顶元素即当前最大元素，重新构建最大堆，取出堆顶排序，以此类推完成排序；
  • 冒泡排序Bubble sort: 从后往前两两元素互相比较，移动最大或最小元素至序列首部，之后比较剩下元素，以此类推完成排序；
  • 快速排序Qucik sort: 选出大小位于中间一个元素，以此元素为基准划为左右两组元素再分别进行排序；
  • 归并排序Merge sort: 划为多组，每组两两进行排序，之后两组两组进行合并、排序，之后合并为最终一组；
  • Counting计数排序: 首先需要限定元素大小，取最大数为k,则设置一个新的数组长度为k+1，统计所有数的个数，填入相对应的位置中，依次相加元素数，再倒序遍历原数组，根据新数组中的位置，排列新的顺序，每排一个，之前记录个数的数组元素减1. (参考：http://www.cnblogs.com/developerY/p/3166462.html )
  • Radix基数排序: 将所有数的数位长度统一，长度不够的前面补零，之后从最低位到最高位分别比较每个数字并排序，直到最高位完成即成为一个有序列；
  • Bucket桶排序: 制定每个桶的规则，然后相对应地分成M个桶，每个桶根据规则填入相对应的元素，每个桶内制定最优排序规则进行排序，最终依次输出每个桶的数据即为有序数列。

实现算法

Insertion Sort:

Insert each element into sorted list. Move the elements to the right position until it is greater than current element and put this element after the current element.

Shell Sort:

At first divide the array into size/2 arrays, utilizing Insertion Sort. Then divide the array into size/4 arrays until 1 array and sort.

Selection Sort:

Each time, find out the maximum element from the last array and switch the head of this last array.

Heap Sort:

We can use PriorityQueue to implement this function.

Bubble Sort:

Adjacent elements take into compare and move the less one into the head. It will be the least one. Then we loop this action until we get the sorted array.

Quick Sort:

Each time, we choose first element of array as pivot.Put all elements which is less than pivot to left and all elements which are greater than pivot to right.

Merge Sort:

Recursively split the list into sublists until the size of sublist is 1. Then merge those sublists to produce one sorted list.

Counting Sort:

If we need sort an array which the value is in [0,k]. Then we will create a new array which the length is k+1. count the value and add the previous number. Then we can get the new index from this array and then get the sorted array.

Radix Sort:

We have an array, each time we sort array based on the value of digit and use counting sort.

学习后总结：

排序算法 Average Time Complexity Worst Time Complexity Space Complexity 稳定性
Insertion Sort O(N^2) O(N^2) O(1) 稳定
Shell Sort O(NlogN) O(N^2) O(1) 不稳定
Selection Sort O(N^2) O(N^2) O(1) 不稳定
Heap Sort O(NlogN) O(N^2) O(1) 不稳定
Bubble Sort O(N^2) O(N^2) O(1) 稳定
Quick Sort O(NlogN) O(N^2) O(logN) 不稳定
Merge Sort O(NlogN) O(NlogN) O(1) 稳定
Counting Sort O(N+k) O(N+k) O(N+k) 稳定
Radix Sort O(logrB) O(logrB) O(N) 稳定
Bucket Sort O(N^2) O(1) 稳定
  • What’s the stable sorting: A sorting algorithm is stable if it preserves the order of duplicate keys.
  • About Sort Linked List, if there is no need constant space, a very efficient and faster way is store all values of nodes into array(or copy list into array) and sort them. Then assign these values into each node.

参考资料：

  1. http://blog.csdn.net/shan9liang/article/details/7533466
  2. http://blog.csdn.net/shan9liang/article/details/7540928
  3. http://www.jianshu.com/p/f5baf7f27a7e

entry.title: Reorder List
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Reorder List.

Description

Given a singly linked list L: L0→L1→…→Ln-1→Ln,
reorder it to: L0→Ln→L1→Ln-1→L2→Ln-2→…

You must do this in-place without altering the nodes’ values.

For example,
Given {1,2,3,4}, reorder it to {1,4,2,3}.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. Iterate the list and store all nodes into ArrayList
  2. insert the node into original list until the middle of list
  3. make the next pointer of the middle to null.
  4. Time complexity and space complexity is O(n)

Solution2

  1. At first find out prior of the middle
  2. reverse the half after middle
  3. reorder the list from the head and the middle.
  4. Time complexity is O(n)and space complexity is O(1)

entry.title: Copy List with Random Pointer
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Copy List with Random Pointer.

Description

A linked list is given such that each node contains an additional random pointer which could point to any node in the list or null.

Return a deep copy of the list.

Solution

Analysis

This is my wrong solution. Although this solution can pass the test cases, every next and random node only has label but no its next and random node.

The correct solution is we need use the new existed node as a next and random node.

Solution1

  1. we utilize HashMap to collect all copy node only with the value;
  2. Each time, we add next and random pointer which is only in this HashMap.
  3. Time complexity and space complexity is O(n)

Solution2

  1. Iterate the original list and duplicate each node. The duplicated node follows its original node.
  2. Iterate the duplicated nodes and assign the next and random pointer for each nodes.
  3. Extract the duplicated nodes and recover the original list
  4. Although the time complexity and space complexity is O(n), the extra space complexity is O(1).

entry.title: Intersection of Two Linked Lists
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Intersection of Two Linked Lists.

Description

Write a program to find the node at which the intersection of two singly linked lists begins.

For example, the following two linked lists:

begin to intersect at node c1.

###Notes

  • If the two linked lists have no intersection at all, return null.
  • The linked lists must retain their original structure after the function returns.
  • You may assume there are no cycles anywhere in the entire linked structure.
  • Your code should preferably run in O(n) time and use only O(1) memory.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

Utilizing HashSet to save each node from headA and compare each node from headB to find out the first intersected node.
Time complexity is O(n) and space complexity is O(n).

Solution2

If we want to run in O(n) time and use only O(1) memory, we should compare headA with headB and traverse each node once. But the point is the length of headA and headB is different.
So in order to counteract the difference, we can splice two lists and find out the intersected node. We suppose that there are A different nodes in the first list, B different nodes in the second list and C common nodes.
Therefore, A + C + B = B + C + A.

entry.title: iOS学习笔记-chapter1~3
entry.content:
此学习笔记根据《iOS开发指南》（第四版）学习总结

Chapter 01

  • iOS 9 新特性：3D Touch, 分屏多任务, Apple pay增强, Wallet
  • Objective-C 多重参数方法的定义：
  • 错误处理约定：给方法传递一个&error(NSError地址)， 当方法调用完成之后，若发生错误则error不为nil，若没有错误则error为nil.

Chapter 02

  • 当新建一个iOS工程后，会产生两个类AppDelegate和ViewController；两个界面布局文件Main.storyboard故事板文件和LaunchScreen.storyboard应用启动界面故事板文件；Assets.xcassets资源目录，可以用来管理图片； Info.plist工程属性文件。
  • AppDelegate 是应用程序委托对象, 继承了UIResponder类，使得具有处理响应事件的能力。外加上UIApplicationDelegate委托协议使得AppDelegate成为应用程序委托对象，这种对象能够响应应用程序的生命周期。
  • 在Asset.xcassets文件夹中，可以放置工程中的图片；Supporting Files组只有一个Info.plist文件，该文件是工程属性描述文件，其中保存着工程的属性设置。在访问资源文件时，文件夹和组是有区别的，访问文件夹中的资源时需要将文件夹作为路径。如果icon.png文件放在image文件夹下，则访问它的路径是image/icon.png;如果image是组，则访问它的路径是icon.png。
  • 应用生命周期：
    Not Running (非运行状态)：应用没有运行或被系统终止；
    Inactive(前台非活动状态)：应用正在进入前台状态，但是还不能接受事件处理；
    Active(前台活动状态)：应用进入前台状态，能接受事件处理；
    Background(后台状态)：应用进入后台后，依然能够执行代码。如果有可执行的代码，就会执行代码，如果没有可执行的代码或将可执行的代码执行完毕，应用会马上进入挂起状态；
    Suspended(挂起状态)：被挂起的应用进入一种“冷冻”状态，不能执行代码。如果系统内存不够，应用会被终止。

场景应用：

  1. 用户点击应用图标的时候，可能是第一次启动这个应用，也可能是应用终止后再次启用：
    Not running -> Inactive : 调用application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:方法，发出UIApplicationDidFinishLaunchingNotification通知。
    Inactive -> Active : 调用applicationDidBecomeActive方法，发出UIApplicationDidBecomeActiveNotification通知。
  2. 应用处于运行状态时点击Home键应用会退出：分为两种情况
    应用可以在后台运行或者挂起:
    Active -> Inactive : 调用applicationWillResignActive方法，发出UIApplicationWillResignActiveNotification通知。
    Inactive -> Background : 应用从非活动状态进入到后台。
    Background -> Suspended : 调用applicationDidEnterBackground方法，发出UIApplicationDidEnterBackgroundNotification通知。
    应用不可以在后台运行或者挂起:
    Active -> Inactive : 应用由活动状态转为非活动状态
    Inactive -> Background : 应用从非活动状态进入后台
    Background -> Suspended : 调用applicationDidEnterBackground方法，发出UIApplicationDidEnterBackgroundNotification通知
    Suspended -> Not running : 调用applicationWillTerminate方法，发出UIApplicationWillTerminateNotification通知。
  3. 挂起状态的应用重新运行:
    Suspended -> Background : 应用从挂起状态进入后台
    Background -> Inactive : 调用applicationWillEnterForeground方法，发出UIApplicationWillEnterForegroundNotification通知
    Inactive -> Active : 调用applicationDidBecomeActive方法， 发出UIApplicationDidBecomeActiveNodification通知。
  4. 应用在后台处理完成是进入挂起状态，如果发出低内存警告，则应用会被清除内存从而终止运行: Background -> Suspended -> Not running

iOS整体框架：

Cocoa Touch 层
Media 层
Core Services 层
Core OS 层

Chapter 03

视图的生命周期

  • 视图创建并加载到内存中，调用viewDidLoad方法，此时视图并未出现；
  • 视图可见，之前会调用viewWillAppear,之后会调用viewDidAppear;
  • 视图不可见，之前会调用viewWillDisappear,之后会调用viewDidDisappear;
  • 系统低内存时，调用didReceiveMemoryWarning方法.

viewDidLoad 方法在应用运行的时候只调用一次，而其他四个方法可以被反复调用多次。

视图属性

  • frame 属性是该视图在父视图坐标系统中的位置和大小
  • bounds 属性是该视图在本地坐标系统中的位置和大小

frame 属性类型是CGRect结构体，CGRect包含 origin 和 size.
origin 是坐标点类型，是CGPoint结构体，包含 x 和 y.
size 是高和宽类型，是CGSize结构体，包含 width 和 height.

构建界面的三种方式

  • storyboard 文件
  • XIB 文件
  • autolayout纯代码文件

团队协调开发的取舍：在一个项目需要很多人协同开发的时候，如果使用Main.storyboard，因为一个工程只有一个storyboard文件，会导致多人需要同时修改storyboard文件时产生错误和冲突；使用XIB和纯代码方式则不会出现这个问题，因为每个Xib文件和纯代码方式都是描述单个界面，文件都是多个、分散、不会发生版本冲突的。但是storyboard的问题的解决方法是统一由一个人来负责修改该文件，其他人员一律不得修改。

entry.title: Day1 DataStructure about List
entry.content:
本篇是关于List的分析和总结.

攻略模板

  • 回忆数据结构：分析数据结构特性，比较类似数据结构差异
  • 实现数据结构
  • 实战训练使用该数据结构
  • 总结该数据结构特点，并总结算法题

Java.util

Collections

List: ArrayList, LinkedList and Array

自己回忆

  • ArrayList: search:O(1), add and delete: O(n). If there are more elements, the capacity expands to 50% more.
  • LinkedList: search:O(n), add and delete: O(1), it has linked node and cost more space. In each node, there are pointer to point pre and next node.
  • Array: initialized with fixed length. search is O(1), add and delete: Actually it equals to creating a new Array without this element(delete) or with this element(add).

实现数据结构

  • ArrayList实现了List, Cloneable, Serializable，RandomAccess. not thread safe.
  • LinkedList 实现了List, Cloneable, Serializable, Deque: Deque 的功能为addFirst,addLast,removeFirst,removeLast等.
  • Vector实现了List, Cloneable, RandomAccess: thread safe. 因为是synchronized . 可以initialize with 增长系数.

学习后总结

  • ArrayList implements RandomAccess interface, so it has higher efficiency in read. It’s internally implemented as array(Object[ ])
  • LinkedList is doubly linked list, so it is faster to add and remove elements. We’re able to access the elements via index from the beginning or the ending, it depends on comparing with this specific index and the middle of the list. It’s internally implemented as doubly linked list. It is a chain of entities, each entity has previous, next pointer and this element.
  • Array can contain primitive data type and object. ArrayList only contains objects.
Array ArrayList
Resizable No, it has fixed size. Yes. the size will grow automatically by 1.5 times
Primitive Contain Primitive data type and Object Only contains Objects, not primitive type.if list.add(1), it will through auto-boxing ensures add object into list.
Length use array.length use list.size()
Add Elements Assignment operator add() method, 添加某一位value,需要使用System.arrayCopy 移动该插入位之后所有元素往后移
Multi-dimensional It can be multi dimensional It is always single dimensional
  • 在LinkedList类型的题目中，如果把head赋给一个新的ListNode, 例如ListNode node = head; 那么对于node的操作都会对original list造成影响。 如果想不造成影响，则需要create a new ListNode. 即ListNode node = new ListNode(-1); 其中: head相当于original list中的头指针，而node为new list中的头指针，如果需要对new list进行操作，可以保留头指针，然后对该new list进行操作。使用ListNode list = node; 最后 return node.next;

entry.title: hexo 常用操作
entry.content:
本篇是关于Hexo的基本操作步骤.

部署步骤

每次部署的步骤，可按以下三步来进行。

一些常用命令：

hexo new “postName” #新建文章

hexo new page”pageName” #新建页面

hexo generate #生成静态页面至public目录

hexo server #开启预览访问端口（默认端口4000，’ctrl + c’关闭server）

hexo deploy #将.deploy目录部署到GitHub

hexo help # 查看帮助

hexo version #查看Hexo的版本

发表博文

  1. 首先cd blog, 进入blog文件夹下， 使用 hexo new “postName” #新建文章
  2. 在source/_post/ 中 会产生 postName.md文件, 直接双击打开 书写博文，保存
  3. 使用 hexo server 本地浏览效果
  4. 使用 hexo clean, hexo generate 和 hexo deploy 部署三部曲 把当前文章部署到服务器上，即完成文章发布。

更换主题

  1. 首先cd blog, 进入blog文件夹下，比如我这里用的是 maupassant 主题
  2. git clone https://github.com/icylogic/maupassant-hexo.git themes/maupassant ，直接会把主题安装到themes/ 下. 也可能需要安装其他支持文件：
  1. 然后修改blog文件夹下 _config.yml 中， theme : maupassant

具体可以参照： here maintained by @tufu9441.

DIY功能以及SEO

参考博客：Coding Plub

entry.title: Remove Nth Node From End of List
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Remove Nth Node From End of List.

Description

Given a linked list, remove the nth node from the end of list and return its head.

For example,

Note:
Given n will always be valid.
Try to do this in one pass.

Solution

Analysis

  1. In order to find this node in one pass, we maintain two pointers and then move the current pointer forward with n steps.
  2. Keep this interval and move two pointers at the same speed until the current pointer reaches to the end.
  3. The previous one points to the previous node of target, then delete this target.
  4. The most important thing is we need ensure what we changed is in the same linked list.
